rev.comment: /* Necrophilia as represented in the arts */
rev.diff:
Line 144: Line 144:
Many of [[death Metal]] band [[Cannibal Corpse]]'s songs are about necrophilia, most notably the song "Necropedophile."
Many of [[death Metal]] band [[Cannibal Corpse]]'s songs are about necrophilia, most notably the song "Necropedophile."
â
The opening line of the[[Cradle of Filth]] song "Lord Abortion" from their album [[Midian]], ("care for a little necrophilia, hm?") is a quote from Terry Gilliam's Brazil (voiced by Kim Greist in the film but delivered on the song by Toni King, the wife of the band's singer/co-creator Dani Filth).
+
The opening line of the [[Cradle of Filth]] song "Lord Abortion" from their album [[Midian]], ("care for a little necrophilia, hm?") is a quote from Terry Gilliam's Brazil (voiced by Kim Greist in the film but delivered on the song by Toni King, the wife of the band's singer/co-creator Dani Filth).
